sen.j: 牧氏事件（まきしじけん）とは、鎌倉時代初期、元久2年（1205年）閏7月に起こった鎌倉幕府の政変。
sen.e: Makishi Incident is a coup that took place in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in August, 1205 in the early Kamakura Period.
The Makishi Incident refers to a coup that took place in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in August, 1205 in the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: The Makishi Incidentとし、is→refers to、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更しました。
sen.e: The Makishi Incident refers to a coup that took place in the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in August, 1205 in the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 正治元年（1199年）に頼朝が死去した後、後継者の源頼家は、若年の上に北条氏や梶原氏など頼朝が重用した御家人を遠ざけて、新たに自分の側近グループで政権を運営しようとした。
sen.e: After Yoritomo's death in 1199, his successor, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, who was young, tried to start managing the government with his close adviser group, shutting away the gokenin (shogunal retainers of the Kamakura bakufu) to whom Yoritomo had given important posts, such as the Hojo clan and the Kajiwara clan.

After Yoritomo's death in 1199, his successor, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, who was young, tried to start managing the government with his close adviser group, shutting away the gokenin (shogunal retainers of the Kamakura bakufu) to whom Yoritomo had given important posts, such as the Hojo clan and the Kajiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを消去しました。
sen.e: After Yoritomo's death in 1199, his successor, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, who was young, tried to start managing the government with his close adviser group, shutting away the gokenin (shogunal retainers of the Kamakura bakufu) to whom Yoritomo had given important posts, such as the Hojo clan and the Kajiwara clan.

sen.j: そこで、幕府内において将軍の独裁権力を抑制するために、有力御家人による合議制が整えられた。
sen.e: Consequently, a council system, consisting of senior vassals, was established in the bakufu in order to control shogun's dictatorship.
Consequently, a council system, consisting of senior vassals, was established in the bakufu in order to control shogun's dictatorship.
Consequently, a council system, consisting of senior vassals, was established in the bakufu in order to control shogun's dictatorship.

sen.j: これは言わば、将軍が有名無実化し、御家人による権力争いが始まる契機となった。
sen.e: This gave an opportunity to make shogun, so to speak, leaders in name only, and start struggles of gokenin for power.
This gave an opportunity to make shogun, so to speak, leaders in name only, and start struggles of gokenin for power.
This gave an opportunity to make shogun, so to speak, leaders in name only, and start struggles of gokenin for power.

sen.j: このような中で頼朝の妻・北条政子の実父である北条時政は、有力御家人である梶原景時や頼家の外戚である比企能員一族を滅ぼして、北条氏の地位を一段と高めてゆく。
sen.e: Under these circumstances, Tokimasa HOJO, who was the father of Masako HOJO, Yoritomo's wife, markedly strengthen the standing of the Hojo clan by destroying Kagetoki KAJIWARA, a senior vassal, and the family of Yoshikazu HIKI, Yoriie's maternal relative.

Under these circumstances, Tokimasa HOJO, who was the father of Masako HOJO, Yoritomo's wife, markedly strengthen the standing of the Hojo clan by destroying Kagetoki KAJIWARA, a senior vassal, and the family of Yoshikazu HIKI, Yoriie's maternal relative.

Under these circumstances, Tokimasa HOJO, who was the father of Masako HOJO, Yoritomo's wife, markedly strengthen the standing of the Hojo clan by destroying Kagetoki KAJIWARA, a senior vassal, and the family of Yoshikazu HIKI, Yoriie's maternal relative.

sen.j: そして遂には頼家も廃して弟の源実朝を新将軍として擁立し、自らは執権となる。
sen.e: And, eventually, he uncrowned Yoriie, backed up his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, as a new shogun, and assumed the post of regent.
And, eventually, he uncrowned Yoriie, backed up his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, as a new shogun, and assumed the post of regent.
And, eventually, he uncrowned Yoriie, backed up his younger brother, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, as a new shogun, and assumed the post of regent.

sen.j: そして、頼家を後に殺害した。
sen.e: And, later he killed Yoriie.
And, later he killed Yoriie.
And, later he killed Yoriie.

sen.j: さて、この時政には後妻に牧の方という女性がいた。
sen.e: Incidentally, Tokimasa had the second wife, Maki no kata (Lady Maki).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Incidentally, Tokimasa had the second wife, Maki no kata (Lady Maki).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを消去しました。
sen.e: Incidentally, Tokimasa had the second wife, Maki no kata (Lady Maki).

sen.j: 頼朝死後における時政の謀略の大半は、この牧の方という女性が全て考え出したものとまで言われている。
sen.e: It is said this lady called Maki no kata schemed most of Tokimasa's conspiracies after the death of Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said this lady called Maki no kata schemed most of Tokimasa's conspiracies after the death of Yoritomo.
It is said this lady called Maki no kata schemed most of Tokimasa's conspiracies after the death of Yoritomo.

sen.j: 彼女は権勢欲が人一倍強かった。
sen.e: She had unusually strong lust for reigns of power.
She had unusually strong lust for the reins of power.
sen.cmt: reigns of power→the reins of powerに修正しました。
sen.e: She had unusually strong lust for the reins of power.

sen.j: 梶原氏、比企氏と有力御家人を滅ぼした北条時政の次の標的は、武蔵国に大勢力を誇る畠山重忠であった。
sen.e: Tokimasa HOJO's next target after overthrowing senior vassals, the Kajiwara and Hiki clans was Shigetada HATAKEYAMA who had strong power in Musashi Province.
Tokimasa HOJO's next target after overthrowing senior vassals, the Kajiwara and Hiki clans was Shigetada HATAKEYAMA who had strong power in Musashi Province.
Tokimasa HOJO's next target after overthrowing senior vassals, the Kajiwara and Hiki clans was Shigetada HATAKEYAMA who had strong power in Musashi Province.

sen.j: この重忠はもとは平清盛の家臣であった。
sen.e: Shigetada was originally TAIRA no Kiyomori's vassal.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Shigetada was originally TAIRA no Kiyomori's vassal.
Shigetada was originally TAIRA no Kiyomori's vassal.

sen.j: 頼朝挙兵時には平家について三浦義明を討つなどして頼朝を追い詰めたこともある。
sen.e: When Yoritomo rose up in arms, Shigetada followed the Taira clan, and drove Yoritomo into the corner by killing Yoshiaki MIURA.
sen.cmt: 英辞朗rose up in arms、一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Yoritomo rose up in arms, Shigetada followed the Taira clan, and drove Yoritomo into the corner by killing Yoshiaki MIURA.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを消去しました。
sen.e: When Yoritomo rose up in arms, Shigetada followed the Taira clan, and drove Yoritomo into the corner by killing Yoshiaki MIURA.

sen.j: 後に頼朝に降伏して、源義仲追討や一の谷の戦い、奥州藤原氏との戦い、比企氏追討などで武功を挙げた。
sen.e: Later, he surrendered to Yoritomo, and distinguished himself in battle by hunting down and killing MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, fighting the Battle of Ichinotani, fighting against the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, hunting down and destroying the Hiki clan, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, he surrendered to Yoritomo, and distinguished himself in battle by hunting down and killing MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, fighting the Battle of Ichinotani, fighting against the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, hunting down and destroying the Hiki clan, and so on.

Later, he surrendered to Yoritomo, and distinguished himself in battle by hunting down and killing MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, fighting the Battle of Ichinotani, fighting against the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, hunting down and destroying the Hiki clan, and so on.

sen.j: 性格も剛直であったことから人望もあり、時政にとって最も邪魔な存在となっていた。
sen.e: Shigetada, who won popularity because of his strong and honest personality, became the greatest hindrance for Tokimasa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Shigetada, who won popularity because of his strong and honest personality, became the greatest hindrance for Tokimasa.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを消去しました。
sen.e: Shigetada, who won popularity because of his strong and honest personality, became the greatest hindrance for Tokimasa.

sen.j: そんな中、重忠の子・畠山重保が時政と牧の方の娘婿である平賀朝雅と対立することとなる。
sen.e: At that time, Shigetada's son, Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, was opposed to Tomomasa HIRAGA, the husband of Tokimasa and Maki no kata's daughter.
At that time, Shigetada's son, Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, was opposed to Tomomasa HIRAGA, the husband of Tokimasa and Maki no kata's daughter.
At that time, Shigetada's son, Shigeyasu HATAKEYAMA, was opposed to Tomomasa HIRAGA, the husband of Tokimasa and Maki no kata's daughter.

sen.j: 元久2年（1205年）、この重保と朝雅の対立を契機として、時政は畠山氏の討滅を計画する。
sen.e: In 1205, the confrontation between Shigeyasu and Tomomasa gave an opportunity for Tokimasa to plan the overthrow of the Hatakeyama clan.
In 1205, the confrontation between Shigeyasu and Tomomasa gave an opportunity for Tokimasa to plan the overthrow of the Hatakeyama clan.
In 1205, the confrontation between Shigeyasu and Tomomasa gave an opportunity for Tokimasa to plan the overthrow of the Hatakeyama clan.

sen.j: このとき、時政の息子である北条義時は、重忠とは友人関係にあり、あまりに強引な畠山氏排斥を唱える父に対して反感を抱く（吾妻鏡より）
sen.e: At that time, Tokimasa's son, Yoshitoki HOJO, maintaining friendly relationship with Shigetada, felt antipathy toward his father who urged the rejection of the Hatakeyama clan too agressively (from "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).

At that time, Tokimasa's son, Yoshitoki HOJO, maintaining friendly relationship with Shigetada, felt antipathy toward his father who urged the rejection of the Hatakeyama clan too agressively (from "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).

At that time, Tokimasa's son, Yoshitoki HOJO, maintaining friendly relationship with Shigetada, felt antipathy toward his father who urged the rejection of the Hatakeyama clan too agressively (from "Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East]).

sen.j: しかし、父の命令に逆らえず、武蔵二俣川にて畠山重忠一族を討ち滅ぼした。
sen.e: However, he could not act counter to his father's order, and destroyed the family of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA in Futamata-gawa, Musashi Province.
However, he could not act counter to his father's order, and destroyed the family of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA in Futamatagawa, Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 地名のため、Futamata-gawa→Futamatagawaとしました。
sen.e: However, he could not act counter to his father's order, and destroyed the family of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA in Futamatagawa, Musashi Province.

sen.j: しかし、人望のあった重忠を強攻策をもって殺したことは、時政と牧の方に対する反感を惹起することになった（畠山重忠の乱）。
sen.e: However, killing through the hard-line tactics Shigetada who was respected caused antipathy to Tokimasa and Maki no kata (Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion).
However, killing through the hard-line tactics Shigetada who was respected caused antipathy to Tokimasa and Maki no kata (the War of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA).
sen.cmt: 統一事項に基づき、Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion→the War of Shigetada HATAKEYAMAとしました。
sen.e: However, killing through the hard-line tactics Shigetada who was respected caused antipathy to Tokimasa and Maki no kata (the War of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA).

sen.j: 同年閏7月、時政と牧の方は、実朝を廃して平賀朝雅を新将軍として擁立しようとする。
sen.e: In August in the same year, Tokimasa and Maki no kata attempted to uncrown Sanetomo, and back up Tomomasa HIRAGA as a new shogun.
In August in the same year, Tokimasa and Maki no kata attempted to uncrown Sanetomo, and back up Tomomasa HIRAGA as a new shogun.
In August in the same year, Tokimasa and Maki no kata attempted to uncrown Sanetomo, and back up Tomomasa HIRAGA as a new shogun.

sen.j: 政権を牛耳るためとはいえ、時政と牧の方のこのようなあまりにも強硬な策は一族の北条政子・北条義時らの反感を招いた。
sen.e: Tokimasa and Maki no kata's action like this to take hold of the government was so aggressive that it provoked antipathy of Masako HOJO, Yoshitoki HOJO, and others in the family.
Tokimasa and Maki no kata's action like this to take hold of the government was so aggressive that it provoked antipathy of Masako HOJO, Yoshitoki HOJO, and others in the family.
Tokimasa and Maki no kata's action like this to take hold of the government was so aggressive that it provoked antipathy of Masako HOJO, Yoshitoki HOJO, and others in the family.

sen.j: 閏7月20日 (旧暦)に、遂に政子と義時は協力して時政を執権から廃して、牧の方と共に強制的に出家させた。
sen.e: On September 12, eventually Masako and Yoshitoki worked together to get rid of Tokimasa from the post of regent, and forced him and Maki no kata to enter the priesthood.
On September 12, eventually Masako and Yoshitoki worked together to get rid of Tokimasa from the post of regent, and forced him and Maki no kata to enter the priesthood.
On September 12, eventually Masako and Yoshitoki worked together to get rid of Tokimasa from the post of regent, and forced him and Maki no kata to enter the priesthood.

sen.j: その後、二人は義時の手によって伊豆国に幽閉されたのである。
sen.e: Later, Yoshitoki imprisoned the two in Izu Province.
Later, Yoshitoki imprisoned the two in Izu Province.
Later, Yoshitoki imprisoned the two in Izu Province.

sen.j: 時政と牧の方はその後、二度と政界に復帰することなく、その生命を終えた。
sen.e: Tokimasa and Maki no kata never returned to the political arena since then, and died.
Tokimasa and Maki no kata never returned to the political arena since then, and died.
Tokimasa and Maki no kata never returned to the political arena since then, and died.

sen.j: また、平賀朝雅も事件後に即座に殺された。
sen.e: And, Tomomasa HIRAGA was killed immediately after the incident.
And, Tomomasa HIRAGA was killed immediately after the incident.
And, Tomomasa HIRAGA was killed immediately after the incident.

sen.j: そして、北条氏の第2代執権には義時が就任し、義時のもとで北条氏は幕府内における地位を確固たるものとしていくのである。
sen.e: Then, Yoshitoki assumed the office of the second regency from the Hojo clan, and Under Yoshitoki's control, the Hojo clan secured its place in the bakufu.
Then, Yoshitoki assumed the office of the second regency from the Hojo clan, and under Yoshitoki's control, the Hojo clan secured its place in the bakufu.
Then, Yoshitoki assumed the office of the second regency from the Hojo clan, and under Yoshitoki's control, the Hojo clan secured its place in the bakufu.

sen.j: ただし、この事件は、後に北条氏内部で起こる執権職をめぐっての内紛の先駆けにもなった。
sen.e: However, this was the beginning of internal conflicts for shikken no shiki which later happened inside the Hojo clan.
However, this was the beginning of internal conflicts for shikken no shiki (post of regent) which later happened inside the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: shikken no shikiの補足追加、余分なスペースを消去しました。
sen.e: However, this was the beginning of internal conflicts for shikken no shiki (post of regent) which later happened inside the Hojo clan.
